{{refimprove|date=September 2017}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} {{Use British English|date=May 2014}} {{Infobox person |honorific-prefix = |name = Sir David Arculus |honorific-suffix = |image = |imagesize = |caption = |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1946|06|02}} |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |restingplace = |birthname = David Arculus |nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] |spouse = |residence = |alma_mater = [[Oriel College, Oxford|Oriel College]], [[University of Oxford]] and the [[London Business School]] |occupation = High Sheriff of Cambridgeshire 2016{{ndash}}2017 |profession = |religion = |signature = |website = |footnotes = }} '''Sir David Arculus''' (born 2 June 1946),<ref name=Birth>{{cite web|title=Birthday's today|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/archive/2011-6-2.html|publisher=The Telegraph|accessdate=31 May 2014|date=2 June 2011|quote=Sir David Arculus, company chairman, 69|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141101232957/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/archive/2011-6-2.html|archivedate=1 November 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref>{{failed verification|date=September 2017}} is a British media figure, [[business]]man and advisor to Government who has appeared several times in ''[[The Sunday Times (UK)|The Sunday Times]]'' Power 100, ranked at number 39 in 2005.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://business.timesonline.co.uk/article/0,,17709-1861705,00.html | work=The Times | location=London | title=30 Sir David Arculus | date=2005-11-07 | accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref>
Educated at [[Bromsgrove School]] (Wendron House) and [[Oriel College, Oxford|Oriel College]], [[University of Oxford]] and the [[London Business School]], he started his career as a writer and was a producer for the [[BBC]] from 1968 to 1974. He joined [[EMAP]] in 1972, and took it from being a small regional newspaper publisher to a large media group. He was involved in launching many new magazines – for instance, ''[[Smash Hits]]'', a journal that printed words to pop songs, which went from an initial circulation of 10,000 to one million within a year, which provided the cash which helped Emap to subsequently become a leader in the world of business communications encompassing magazines, events, exhibitions and data products.
As a result of these successes Arculus worked his way up to Group Managing Director in 1989, leaving Emap in 1997. He subsequently became Chief Operating Officer of [[United News and Media]] and then became Chairman of IPC Media which at the time was Britain’s largest management buy-out. Arculus also headed [[Earls Court]] and Olympia Ltd and spent nearly ten years as a Non-Executive Director of [[Pearson PLC|Pearson]] plc.
Away from the media sector, he was a Non-Executive Director of [[Severn Trent]] plc from 1996, serving as Chairman from 1998 until 2004. Arculus held a range of further non-executive jobs of which perhaps the most noteworthy was with [[Barclays Bank]] plc from 1997 to 2006.
He joined the Board of [[Telefónica Europe|O2]] plc in 2003, and in 2006 as Chairman was responsible with the management team for the sale of O2 to [[Telefónica]] of Spain. At £18bn this was the largest cash deal ever done in Europe, and the second biggest in the world. Following the 2006 merger of O2 and Telefonica he sat on the Board of Telefonica. David has also served as a Director of Barclays and Pearson and of a variety of private equity backed companies and was Chairman of [[ExCeL Exhibition Centre]]
During his career David has also undertaken a number of non-business roles including four years (2002 to 2006) as Tony Blair’s "Red Tape Czar" when he was Chairman of the British Government’s Better Regulation Task Force. During this time he helped bring about a number of regulatory initiatives intended to reduce burdens on business. These included improved impact assessments; the introduction of common commencement dates and the measurement of administrative burden in the UK economy which led to government imposing a 25% red tape reduction across all departments.{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} He also led the effort during the UK Presidency to reduce EU bureaucratic burdens which resulted in the notable claim from MEPs that "the European Parliament now has nothing to do".
Arculus has also been a member of the National Consumer Council and chaired both the [[Royal Institution]] and the Advisory Council of The [[British Library]] as well as being a Trustee of various charitable organisations.
Alongside his role as High Sheriff of Cambridgeshire 2016{{ndash}}2017, David is currently the Chairman of Energy UK.
==References== <references/>
==External links== *[https://web.archive.org/web/20070206154029/http://www.o2.com/about/arculus.asp Bio at O2]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Arculus, David}} [[Category:1946 births]] [[Category:Alumni of Oriel College, Oxford]] [[Category:Alumni of the London Business School]] [[Category:Ascential]] [[Category:British businesspeople]] [[Category:Businesspeople awarded knighthoods]] [[Category:High Sheriffs of Cambridgeshire]] [[Category:Knights Bachelor]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People educated at Bromsgrove School]]

'''David Julian Buchler''' (b. 31 December 1951 in London) is a British businessman, best known as a practitioner in the field of corporate recovery and restructuring. He is closely associated with Tottenham Hotspur F.C. and the English National Opera (ENO).
==Career==
Educated at [[Highgate School]] in London, David Buchler entered the [[accountancy]] profession in 1970 as an articled clerk (trainee Chartered Accountant) with Bernard Phillips & Co. When the firm merged with [[Arthur Andersen]] in 1979, Buchler transferred as a Partner and continued to build his reputation as an insolvency practitioner. In 1988 he launched Buchler Phillips with his longtime business partner Peter Phillips, undertaking several high profile corporate recovery assignments, including the receivership of [[Robert Maxwell]]'s private estate.<ref>Stokdyk, John. [https://www.accountancyage.com/aa/news/1769766/buchler-phillips-told-maxwell-receivership-fee"Buchler Phillips told it can keep 99% of Maxwell receivership fee"], "[[Accountancy Age]]", London, 16 March 1999. Retrieved on 16 March 1999.</ref><ref>Guilfoyle,Brendan. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/market-leaders-who-is-the-finest-winding-up-merchant-1081098.html "Market leaders: Who is the finest winding-up merchant?"], "[[The Independent]]", London, 17 March 1999. Retrieved on 17 March 1999.</ref> Buchler Phillips was acquired in 1999 by global consulting firm [[Kroll Inc.]],<ref>New York Times. [https://www.nytimes.com/1999/06/04/business/company-briefs-007463.html"Company Briefs: Kroll O'Gara Co."], "[[New York Times]]", New York, 4 June 1999. Retrieved on 4 June 1999.</ref> after which David Buchler became the new parent's Chairman for Europe and Africa until 2003. During that year he served as President of R3, the Association of Business Recovery Professionals.
In April 2008 it was reported that David Buchler was leading a [[private equity]] backed approach to buy Kroll from its then parent, [[Marsh & McLennan]].<ref>Felsted, Andrea. [https://www.ft.com/content/f7dc9ec4-16eb-11dd-bbfc-0000779fd2ac "Turnaround specialist heads bid for Kroll"], "[[Financial Times]]", London, 30 April 2008. Retrieved on 30 April 2008.</ref><ref>Goodway, Nick. [https://www.standard.co.uk/business/turnaround-king-eyes-kroll-6644634.html "Turnaround king eyes Kroll"], "[[London Evening Standard]]" London, 1 May 2008. Retrieved on 1 May 2008.</ref> In December 2008 David Buchler entered the bid process to acquire stricken [[high street]] retailer [[F. W. Woolworth Company|Woolworths]].<ref>Hall, James. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/newsbysector/retailandconsumer/3568554/Former-Spurs-executive-makes-surprise-bid-for-Woolworths.html "Former Spurs executive makes surprise bid for Woolworths"], "[[Daily Telegraph]]", London, 5 December 2008. Retrieved on 5 December 2008.</ref><ref>Berwin, Lisa. [https://www.retail-week.com/ex-kroll-chief-david-buchler-circles-woolworths/1943061.article "Ex-Kroll chief David Buchler circles Woolworths"], "[[Retail Week]]", London, 8 December 2008. Retrieved on 8 December 2008.</ref> Forming his independent business, DB Consultants, in 2005, David Buchler spent the 10 years that followed focusing on a diverse portfolio of complex restructuring and turnaround assignments with both publicly listed and private companies, often working as Chairman. The most notable of these were leading the fraud investigation at [[Langbar International]],<ref>Jivkov, Michael. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Draft:David_Buchler&action=edit&section=1 "Langbar calls on insolvency expert to find cash"], "[[The Independent]]", London, 20 December 2005. Retrieved on 20 December 2005.</ref> chairing sports management group CSS Stellar, and restructuring former e-security group [[Baltimore Technologies]].
In 2009, Buchler launched a turnaround focused private equity business, Merchant Asset Partners, to raise £500m for a one-time only fund to invest in UK distressed deals. David Buchler has been Chairman of Chinese investment group London Asia Capital since 2011 and of growth capital investor Volvere plc since 2013.<ref>Cocker, Maryam. [http://www.morningstar.co.uk/uk/news/AN_1495789996366422600/volvere-says-momentum-continued-into-2017-as-annual-profit-rises.aspx "Volvere says momentum continued in 2017 as annual profits rise"], ''Alliance News'', London, 26 May 2017. Retrieved 26 May 2017.</ref> In January 2017 he was appointed Chairman of Puma VCT 13 PLC. Buchler Phillips was relaunched in 2015, focusing on financial restructuring, operational turnaround and corporate recovery.
== Football ==
David Buchler has been involved in football club restructuring since 1992, when Buchler Phillips was appointed administrator to Harrow and Wealdstone FC.<ref>Willcock, John. [https://www.independent.co.uk/news/business/people-and-business-1078491.html "Crystal Palace picks Buchler"], "[[The Independent]]", London, 5 March 1999. Retrieved on 5 March 1999.</ref> During the 1990s he advised [[Luton Town F.C.]], [[Millwall F.C.]], [[Oxford United F.C.]], [[Swindon Town F.C.]] and [[Barnet F.C.]],<ref>Schlesinger, Larry. [https://www.accountancyage.com/aa/news/1782298/buchler-months-earn-spurs "Buchler has six months to earn his spurs"], "[[Accountancy Age]]", London, 5 March 2001. Retrieved on 5 March 2001.</ref> before joining the board of [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.]], where he was Vice Chairman from 2001 to 2006.<ref>Bruce-Ball, Jim. [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/3027955/Football-Focus-Buchlers-insolvency-warning.html "Buchler's insolvency warning"], "[[Daily Telegraph]]", London, 18 May 2002. Retrieved on 18 May 2002.</ref> In 2002, David Buchler's eldest daughter, Sara, married Darren Dein, son of [[David Dein]] the then Vice Chairman of North London football rivals [[Arsenal F.C.]]<ref name="Evening Standard 2002">{{cite web | title=Love match unites Spurs and Gunners | website=Evening Standard | date=11 January 2002 | url=https://www.standard.co.uk/news/love-match-unites-spurs-and-gunners-6331256.html | access-date=11 December 2017}}</ref>
== Opera ==
A lifelong opera fan, David Buchler joined the board of the then financially troubled [[English National Opera]] in October 2006. Within months he became Deputy Chairman, a position he held for 10 years. He is presently ENO's Chairman of Directors Emeriti. In June 2017 David Buchler launched a website to chronicle his personal reviews of performances all over the world.<ref>Walsh, Dominic. [https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/staycity-decides-to-go-for-a-walk-on-the-wilde-side-xn2q3mbqt "City People: All the world's a stage"], "[[The Times]]", London, 11 July 2017.</ref>
== References == {{reflist}}
[[Category:British businesspeople]] {{DEFAULTSORT:Buchler, David}} [[Category:1951 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:British accountants]] [[Category:People educated at Highgate School]] [[Category:People from London]]

revision.comment: /* History */ Wow, more than 7 years out of date! No mention of the waterfront here.
revision.text:
[[File:DetroitSkyline.jpg|thumb|300px|Skyline of Detroit at night]] The '''Detroit International Riverfront''' is a [[Tourism in metropolitan Detroit|tourist attraction]] and landmark of [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]] extending from the [[Ambassador Bridge]] in the west to [[Belle Isle Park (Michigan)|Belle Isle]] in the east, for a total of 5.5 miles (8.8 kilometers). The International Riverfront encompasses a cruise ship passenger terminal and dock, a marina, a multitude of parks, restaurants, retail shops, [[List of tallest buildings in Detroit|skyscrapers]], and high rise residential areas along with [[Cobo Center]]. The Marriott at the [[Renaissance Center]] and the [[Riverwalk Hotel Detroit|Robert's Riverwalk Hotel]] are also situated along the International Riverfront. Private companies and foundations together with the city, state, and federal government have contributed several hundred million dollars toward the riverfront development. Key public spaces in the International Riverfront, such as the RiverWalk, [[Dequindre Cut|Dequindre Cut Greenway and Trail]], [[William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor]], and a cruise ship passenger terminal and dock at [[Hart Plaza]] complement the [[architecture of metropolitan Detroit|architecture]] of the area.<ref name=conservancy>{{cite web|url=http://www.detroitriverfront.org/ |title=Detroit Riverfront Conservancy |publisher=Detroitriverfront.org |date= |accessdate=2013-12-03}}</ref> The area provides a venue for a variety of annual events and festivals including the [[Detroit Electronic Music Festival]], Detroit Free Press International Marathon, the [[Detroit International Jazz Festival]], [[Motor City Pride]], the [[North American International Auto Show]], and River Days.
==History== {{wide image|Skyline of Detroit, Michigan from S 2014-12-07.jpg|1000px|align-cap=center| Panorama of the Detroit International Riverfront}} The Detroit Riverfront Conservancy, incorporated as a [[501(c)(3)]] organization, helped raise funds for the International Riverfront project.<ref name=conservancy/> Developers planned the initial east riverfront promenade investment at $559 million, which included contributions of $135 million from GM and $50 million from the Kresge foundation.<ref>Detroit News Editorial (December 13, 2002). At Last, Sensible Dream for Detroit's Riverfront. ''Detroit News''.</ref>
==Features== The area contains the [[Detroit River International Wildlife Refuge]] which is the only international [[wildlife preserve]] in [[North America]], uniquely located in the heart of a major metropolitan area. The Refuge includes islands, coastal wetlands, marshes, shoals, and waterfront lands along {{convert|48|mi|km}} of the [[Detroit River]] and [[Western Lake Erie]] shoreline.
[[File:Belle Isle casino and fountain - Detroit Michigan.jpg|thumb|left|alt=James Scott Fountain and Belle Isle Casino|James Scott Fountain and Belle Isle Casino]]
===Belle Isle Park=== {{Main|Belle Isle Park (Michigan)}}
'''[[Belle Isle Park (Michigan)|Belle Isle Park]]''' is a {{convert|982|acre|ha sqmi}} island [[state park]] in the [[Detroit River]] managed by the [[Government of Michigan|State of Michigan]]. Until November 12, 2013, it was a city-operated park operated by the [[City of Detroit]] Recreation Department. It connects to the city by the [[MacArthur Bridge (Detroit)|MacArthur Bridge]]. It is home to the [[Anna Scripps Whitcomb Conservatory]] (1904), the oldest conservatory in the United States, the [[Detroit Yacht Club]], the [[Detroit Boat Club]], the [[Dossin Great Lakes Museum]], a [[United States Coast Guard|Coast Guard]] post, and a municipal [[golf]] course. The park contains a Nature Center where visitors are able to traverse wooded trails and view wildlife natural habitats. The island includes a half-mile (800 m) swimming beach.
===Chene Park=== {{Infobox park | name = Chene Park | photo = CheneParkAmpitheatre.jpg | photo_width = 225 | photo_caption = Chene Park amphitheatre | type = Municipal | location = 2600 Atwater St., [[Detroit]] | coords = {{Coord|42|20|1.89|N|83|1|17.14|W|}} | area = | created = | operator = | visitation_num = | status = | open = }} '''Chene Park''' is located on the near east side of [[Detroit]], at the foot of Chene Street, along the banks of the [[Detroit River]]. Located just east of Tri-Centennial State Park and [[Harbor]], it contains a 6,000-seat [[amphitheater]] where concerts are regularly scheduled every summer. [[Jazz]], Classic [[Soul music|Soul]] and [[Rhythm and Blues]] acts are the staples of the season. The [[park]] also includes park trails, the Chene Park Fountain, and the Lake Lounge bar. The Detroit Riverfront Conservancy has connected the park to the [[Renaissance Center]] along a riverside promenade.
The park is named for Charles Chene, a French immigrant who owned a strip of land along the shores of the Detroit River that extended into what is now just east of downtown.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://musicwikidetroit.org/index.php?title=Chene_Park_Amphitheatre|title=Chene Park Amphitheatre|work=MusicWiki Detroit|access-date=2018-08-31|language=en}}</ref> On September 4, 2018, Detroit City Council unanimously voted to rename Chene Park the Aretha Louise Franklin Amphitheater after [[Aretha Franklin|the famous singer]] who passed away on August 16, 2018. The change will take place before the 2019 season.<ref>{{cite web|first=Christine|last=Ferretti|title=Detroit council OKs renaming Chene Park after Aretha Franklin|url=https://www.detroitnews.com/story/news/local/detroit-city/2018/09/04/detroit-council-oks-renaming-chene-park-after-aretha-franklin/1189496002/|website=The Detroit News|date=September 4, 2018|accessdate=October 5, 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|first=Rochelle|last=Riley|title=Aretha Franklin's name on Chane Park Ok'd by city council|url=https://www.freep.com/story/news/columnists/rochelle-riley/2018/09/04/aretha-franklins-name-chene-park-okd-city-council/1190812002/|website=Detroit Free Press|date=September 4, 2018|accessdate=October 5, 2018}}</ref>
[[File:Dequindre Cut Detroit a.JPG|thumb|left|Dequindre Cut Greenway looking north.]]
===Dequindre Cut Greenway=== {{Main|Dequindre Cut}} '''Dequindre Cut Greenway''' is a non-motorized trail extending from the [[Detroit River]] northward, with the future potential to connect to the Ferndale-Birmingham greenway in [[Oakland County]]. The mile (1.6 km) long trail primarily connects the [[Lafayette Park, Detroit|Lafayette Park]] neighborhood and [[Eastern Market Historic District|Eastern Market]] to the Riverwalk. The [[Greenway (landscape)|greenway]] utilizes half of the corridor, with a {{convert|20|ft|m|adj=on}} wide paved path with separate lanes for biking and walking.<ref name=conservancy/>
Construction of phase I of the Dequindre Cut Greenway, extending from the River one mile (1.6 km) north to Gratiot Avenue, is complete. Funded by MDOT’s Transportation Enhancement Program and the Community Foundation of Southeast Michigan, this portion of the greenway sets the template for future phases and includes a {{convert|20|ft|m|adj=on}} bituminous path; access ramps for bicyclists, pedestrians and emergency vehicles; landscaping; lighting; signage and security cameras. The first phase of the trail officially opened May 14, 2009 with an opening ribbon-cutting ceremony at the Woodbridge Street entrance of the greenway between Orleans Street and St. Aubin Street.
The Dequindre Cut Greenway phase II North project begins at the northern terminus of the phase I at [[Gratiot Avenue]] and continues for over one-half mile to Mack Avenue. The strategic plan for phase II provides a design approach and project budget that builds on the lessons learned in phase I construction.
The Dequindre Cut is noted for the high quality [[graffiti]] covering the walls of the corridor. The Riverfront Conservancy which operates the greenway will permit current and future painted art work to remain as long as it is not deemed offensive. The trail is one of the city's few public art parks and is a major attraction for urban photographers.<ref name=conservancy/>
[[File:DavidStottsitsamongDetroittowers.jpg|thumb|right|[[Detroit Financial District]] skyline at [[Hart Plaza]]]]
===GM Plaza and Promenade=== {{Main|Renaissance Center}} The '''[[Renaissance Center]]''', nicknamed the '''RenCen''', is a group of seven interconnected [[List of tallest buildings in Detroit|skyscrapers]] in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]], and the tallest building in Michigan since 1977. Located on the Detroit International Riverfront, the entire Renaissance Center complex is owned by [[General Motors]]. The central tower is occupied by the '''Detroit [[Marriott International|Marriott]] at the Renaissance Center''', the tallest all-hotel skyscraper in the [[Western Hemisphere]] with the largest rooftop restaurant, called Coach Insignia. The complex contains many restaurants, a variety of shops, and the vehicle display known as GM World. GM donated its portion of the plaza and promenade to the Riverfront Conservancy upon completion. A cruise-ship passenger terminal stands on Hart Plaza, adjacent to the Renaissance Center. In 2003, [[General Motors]] completed a $500 million renovation of the Renaissance Center for its world headquarters which it had purchased in 1996. [[Skidmore, Owings & Merrill]], Gensler, the [[Smith Hinchman & Grylls|Smith Group]], and Ghafari Associates were among the architects for the renovation. The majority of the construction operations were led by Turner Construction Company. The renovation included the addition of a five-story Wintergarden which provides access to the Detroit International Riverfront.<ref>AIA Detroit Urban Priorities Committee, (1-10-2006).[http://www.modeldmedia.com/features/lookinside.aspx Top 10 Detroit Interiors]''Model D Media''</ref>
Work continued in and around the complex until 2005. The Renaissance Center totals 5.5 million square feet (511,000 m²), making it one of the world's largest office complexes.
[[File:Ml-full-sail.jpg|left|thumb|[[Tall ship]]s occasionally dock in Detroit.]]
===Hart Plaza and the Dock of Detroit=== {{main|Philip A. Hart Plaza}} '''[[Philip A. Hart Plaza]]''' in [[downtown Detroit]], is a [[Urban park|city plaza]] along the [[Detroit River]]. It is located more or less on the site at which [[Antoine de la Mothe Cadillac]] landed in 1701 when he founded ''Fort Pontchartrain du Détroit'', the settlement that became Detroit. In 2011, the Detroit-Wayne County [[Port Authority]] opened its new [[cruise ship]] passenger terminal and dock at Hart Plaza, adjacent to the Renaissance Center, which receives major cruise ships such as the [[MS Columbus]] and the Yorktown.<ref name=dock>[http://www.prnewswire.com/cgi-bin/stories.pl?ACCT=109&STORY=/www/story/06-21-2004/0002196961&EDATE= Detroit Wayne County Port Authority Breaks Ground on $11.25 Million Public Dock and Terminal].(June 21, 2004).''PRNewswire''. Retrieved on January 20, 2008.</ref>
The {{convert|14|acre|ha|adj=on}} plaza, which is named for the late U.S. Senator [[Philip Hart]], opened in 1975 and has a capacity for about 40,000 people.{{citation needed|date=May 2012}} At the center of the plaza is the [[Horace E. Dodge]] and Son Memorial Fountain, designed by [[Isamu Noguchi]] and Walter Budd in 1978.
===River Place=== {{main|River Place (Detroit, Michigan)}} The historic [[Stroh Brewery Company|Stroh]] '''[[River Place (Detroit, Michigan)|River Place]]''' complex is a mixed-use residential development adjacent to the [[Riverwalk Hotel Detroit|Roberts Riverwalk Hotel and Residence]], the redeveloped site of the [[Parke-Davis]] research laboratory, a [[List of National Historic Landmarks in Michigan|National Historic Landmark]] located along the east riverfront promenade. The historic [[Dry Dock Complex (Detroit, Michigan)|Dry Dock Complex]] is an additional redeveloped site along the east riverfront which includes residential units and retail.
<!-- Deleted image removed: [[File:DIR Banner.jpg|left|thumb|Riverfront signage]] -->
===River Walk=== {{Infobox park | name = River Walk | photo = GM Plaza and Promenade.JPG | photo_width = 225 | photo_caption = GM Plaza and Promenade on the riverfront at the [[Renaissance Center]] | type = Municipal | location = [[Detroit]] | coords = | area = | created = 2007 | operator = | visitation_num = | status = | open = }} The Detroit International Riverfront includes a 5½-mile (8.8 km) promenade called the River Walk which is to extend from the [[Ambassador Bridge]] to [[Belle Isle (Michigan)|Belle Isle]]. The path is located directly on the river, sometimes bridging it. The path is 62 feet (18¾ m) wide in most places, with separate lanes for pedestrian and wheeled (such as [[bicycles]] or [[inline skate]]) traffic. Pavilions, fishing piers and benches are located at intervals along the path.<ref name=conservancy/>
The east riverfront promenade connects an area known as Rivertown. It extends along the east riverfront area from the [[Cobo Center]] convention and exhibit facility to the [[Belle Isle Park|Belle Isle State Park]] bridge and includes the [[Renaissance Center]], GM Plaza and Promenade, [[William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor]], [[Stroh Brewery Company|Stroh]] [[River Place Complex (Detroit, Michigan)|River Place]], Chene Park, Mt Elliott Park and [[Gabriel Richard]] Park. The river walk is designed to supplement new retail and residential development, and includes the newly renovated historic [[Alden Park Towers]]. Architect [[Eric J. Hill]] aided in its design.<ref name=conservancy/>
The first {{convert|3.5|mi|km}} of continuous riverfront promenade and two of the four planned pavilions opened to the public on June 6, 2007. Rivard Plaza located at the foot of Rivard Street features a covered seating, a carousel, concessions and bike rentals. Richard Plaza located in Gabriel Richard Park features covered seating, concessions and a butterfly garden. The River Walk is continuous from Joe Louis Arena to Milliken State Park with unfinished sections between the state park and River Place. From River Place the River Walk is then continuous through Mt Elliott Park to the former site of the Uniroyal Tire factory west of Belle Isle. The west riverfront promenade development is not expected to be completed before 2012. The west riverfront includes the high-rise [[Riverfront Condominiums Detroit|Riverfront Towers]]. The west riverfront promenade will eventually connect to [[River Rouge (Michigan)|River Rouge]] in the southwest side.<ref name=conservancy/>
[[File:DowntownDetroit.jpg|thumb|left|View of the [[William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor]] from across the [[Detroit River]]|alt=View of the state park from across the Detroit River]]
===William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor=== {{main|William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor}} '''[[William G. Milliken State Park and Harbor]]''' (formerly ''Tri-Centennial State Park and Harbor'') is a [[state park]] in [[Michigan]], and one of only two state parks located within an urban area. The park consist of the former city-owned St. Aubin Park and Marina. Located just east of downtown [[Detroit]] in the Near-East Riverfront, it covers {{convert|31|acre|ha}} on the [[Detroit River]], and includes a 52-slip harbor of refuge. A {{convert|63|ft|m|adj=on}} conical brick light tower marks the harbor entrance. The park's first phase opened in 2003, included refurbishing of the marina and construction of lighthouse. Construction on the second phase, adjacent to Rivard Plaza, to expand the park started in summer 2008 and was completed in summer 2009. In fall 2009, the state park was renamed in honor of former Michigan [[Governor of Michigan|Governor]] [[William G. Milliken]].
==Riverfront activities== [[File:Fireworks DetroitWindsorIntlFreedomFest.jpg|thumb|right|Freedom festival's fireworks]] Detroit River Days, a five-day festival on the International Riverfront, marked the 2007 opening of the riverfront promenade along the east river leading up to the [[Windsor-Detroit International Freedom Festival|Detroit-Windsor International Freedom Festival]] fireworks. [[Detroit]] and [[Windsor, Ontario|Windsor]] jointly celebrate the multi-day festival the last week of June which draws about 3.5 million visitors during the week in order to commemorate each country's respective [[National Day|National holiday]] - ([[Independence Day (United States)|US Independence Day]] on July 4 and [[Canada Day]] on July 1). The festival began in 1959. It is organized by the Parade Company, a well sponsored not-for-profit organization governed by the Michigan Thanksgiving Parade Foundation.
Traditionally, several days of events were planned, ending with one of the world's largest [[fireworks]] displays,<ref name=Mink>Mink, Randy, and Karen Mink (July 2001).Detroit Turns 300 - Detroit 300 Festival. ''Travel America'', World Publishing Co., Gale Group.</ref> sponsored by [[Target Corporation|Target]]. In prior years, the fireworks display has been billed as the world's largest. On the Windsor side, there is a midway consisting of carnival rides and concessions during the festival. The Midway operates as stand-alone attraction at the end of June, beginning of July.
The [[Detroit Electronic Music Festival]] (DEMF) is an electronic dance music showcase held in Hart Plaza each Memorial Day weekend since 2000. In subsequent years, the similarly themed festivals Movement (2003–2004), Fuse-In (2005) and currently, Movement: Detroit's Electronic Music Festival (2006–present) continue the DEMF's traditions, with each name change reflecting shifts in festival management. All of these festivals featured performances by musicians and DJs, and emphasized the progressive qualities of the culture surrounding electronic music.
The International Riverfront is host to part of the [[Detroit International Jazz Festival]] held in Hart Plaza each Labor Day weekend. Hart Plaza is also the traditional location of rallies to celebrate championships won by Detroit's major sports teams. Both Detroit and Windsor have hosted the [[Red Bull Air Race World Championship]] on the International Riverfront.
==Photo gallery== <gallery> File:DetroitWaterfront1901.jpg|Riverfront circa 1901 File:View of Detroit from Ceasar Windsor Theatre hallway.jpg|View from [[Caesars Windsor]] casino resort overlooking Detroit. File:DetroitRiverwalklookingupriverfromRenCenspring2007.jpg|Looking upriver to [[Belle Isle Park|Belle Isle State Park]]. File:Detroit International Riverfront Rivard Place Merry Go Round.jpg|Rivard Plaza includes a Merry-Go-Round File:Detroit Dry Dock No 2 2009.jpg|[[Dry Dock Complex (Detroit, Michigan)|Dry Dock Complex]] historic redevelopment File:Detroit, USA Taken From Windsor, Canada.jpg|Skyline along the International Riverfront File:Renaissance Center, Detroit, Michigan from S 2014-12-07.jpg|Renaissance Center File:Detroit from Belle Isle.jpg|Detroit's skyline as seen from Belle Isle </gallery>
==See also== {{Portal|Metro Detroit}} * [[List of contemporary amphitheatres]]
==Notes== {{Reflist}}
==References and further reading== *{{Cite book|author=Cantor, George|title=Detroit: An Insiders Guide to Michigan|year=2005|publisher=University of Michigan Press|isbn=0472030922}} *{{Cite book | author=Hill, Eric J. and John Gallagher | title= AIA Detroit: The American Institute of Architects Guide to Detroit Architecture| year=2002 | publisher= Wayne State University Press | isbn=0-8143-3120-3}} *{{Cite book | author= Rodriguez, Michael and Thomas Featherstone| title=Detroit's Belle Isle Island Park Gem (Images of America)| publisher=Arcadia Publishing| year=2003| isbn=0-7385-2315-1}} *{{Cite book | author=Sobocinski, Melanie Grunow | title= Detroit and Rome: building on the past | publisher=Regents of the University of Michigan| year=2005 | isbn=0933691092}}

{{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Location-based asset management.png|thumb|500x500px|A critical requirement for distribution software is '''Inventory Visibility''' which includes both internal inventory visibility (above) as well as visibility across the supply chain (vendors and customers)]] '''Distribution software''' refers to software which manages everything from [[order processing]] and [[inventory]] control to [[accounting]], purchasing and [[customer service]], [[supply chain]] management, sales, [[customer relationship management]], and finance management.
More sophisticated solutions can cover areas such as advanced forecasting and replenishment, warehouse management, pick, pack & shipping, EDI or [[Electronic Data Interchange]], Trade Spend Management and more.
Distribution software helps companies to manage internal and external resources efficiently by minimizing stockouts but ensuring overstocking doesn't occur as well.
Numerous ERP vendors such as [[Acumatica]], [[NAV-X|Microsoft Dynamics NAV-X]], [[Netsuite]], [[Infor|Infor Distribution]], and [[SAP ERP]] offer distribution software as part of their ERP systems.

revision.comment: /* Renewal for active enrolled agents */Improved notes.
revision.text:
{{ infobox | abovestyle = | above = | image = [[file:IRS-EA-2018.jpg|250px]] | caption = | |headerstyle = background:#E6E6E6; | header1 = License overview | label2 = Established | data2 = July 7, 1884 | label3 = Credential | data3 = EA, or E.A. | header3 = | label4 = Licensor | data4 = IRS | header5 = Contact | label6 = | data6 = Internal Revenue Service
Enrolled Agent Policy & Management
P.O. Box 33968
Detroit, MI 48232
855-472-5540 | header7= Website | data8 = [https://www.irs.gov www.irs.gov]}} '''Enrolled agent''' (or '''EA''') is a [[tax advisor]] who is a federally authorized tax practitioner empowered by the U.S. Department of the Treasury. Enrolled agents represent taxpayers before the [[Internal Revenue Service]] (IRS) for tax issues including audits, collections and appeals. Enrolled agent status is the highest credential awarded by the IRS.Enrolled Agent Information, Internal Revenue Service, U.S. Dep't of the Treasury, at [https://www.irs.gov/Tax-Professionals/Enrolled-Agents/Enrolled-Agent-Information]. The EA credential is recognized across all 50 [[U.S. states]]. [[Attorneys in the United States|Attorneys]] and [[Certified Public Accountant|certified public accountants]] (CPAs) are licensed on a state by state basis, and are also empowered by the Department of the Treasury to represent taxpayers before the IRS.National Association of Enrolled Agents, "What Is An Enrolled Agent?" According to the National Association of Enrolled Agents, there are approximately 53,000 practicing EAs in the United States. ==History== The position of enrolled agent was created as a reaction to fraudulent war loss claims in the wake of the [[American Civil War]] with roots tracing back to the General Deficiency Act of July 7, 1884,In section 3 of the General Deficiency Act of July 7, 1884, under the heading “War Department,” Congress authorized appropriation of $125,787.03 for “horses and other property lost in the military service prior to July 1, 1881." or General Deficiency Appropriation Bill (H.R. 2735), also known as the "Horse Act of 1884", which was signed into law by President [[Chester A. Arthur]] on July 7, 1884. After the Civil War, many citizens faced difficulties in settling claims with the government for property confiscated for use in the war effort. As a result, Congress endowed enrolled agents with the power of advocacy to prepare claims against the government. From 1884 through the early 20th century, this statute remained largely unchanged. When the [[Revenue Act of 1913]] was passed, signed into law by President [[Woodrow Wilson]] on October 3, 1913, the scope of the enrolled agent was expanded to include claims for monetary relief for citizens whose taxes had become inequitable. As [[Income tax in the United States|income]], [[Estate tax in the United States|estate]], [[Gift tax in the United States|gift]] and other sources of tax collections became more complex, the role of the enrolled agent increased to include the preparation of the many tax forms that were required. As a result of this complexity, audits became more prevalent and the enrolled agent role evolved into taxpayer representation, promulgating a series of statutes which were combined into a single Treasury Department Circular in February 19, 1921, known as [[Circular 230]], to address "the laws and regulations governing the recognition of agents, attorneys, and other persons representing claimants before the Treasury Department and offices thereof." ==Becoming an enrolled agent== To become an enrolled agent, an applicant must obtain a [[Preparer Tax Identification Number|PTIN]] and achieve passing scores on all three parts of the [[Special Enrollment Examination]], which covers many aspects of the [[Internal Revenue Code]], or must have worked at the IRS for five consecutive years in a position which regularly engaged in applying and interpreting the provisions of the Internal Revenue Code and the regulations relating to income, estate, gift, employment, or excise taxes. A [[background check]], including a review of the applicant’s personal and business tax compliance,Phillips, Michael R., Deputy Inspector General for Audit, Office of Professional Responsibility, Memorandum 2006-10-170. [http://www.treasury.gov/tigta/auditreports/2006reports/200610170fr.html www.treasury.gov/tigta/auditreports/2006reports/200610170fr.html]. is conducted after an applicant files Form 23, ''Application for Enrollment to Practice Before the Internal Revenue Service'', within one year of completing all three parts of the examination. ==Maintaining enrolled agent status== ===Renewal for active enrolled agents=== To qualify for renewal as an enrolled agent, an individual must complete 72 hours of continuing professional education (CPE) every three years, including two hours of ethics or professional conduct in each of the three years.{{cite web |url=https://www.sequoiacpe.com/ea-cpe-requirements|title=Enrolled Agent CPE Requirements|publisher=SequoiaCPE|accessdate=24 March 2014}} To prevent overloading of CPEs in any year of an enrollment cycle, the IRS requires a minimum of 16 hours of CPE every year.{{cite web|url=http://www.mypescpe.com/CPE-Self-Study-CPE-for-Accounting-Audit-Ethics-Tax-CFPs-Etc.cmc?&view=4E|title=EA CPE Requirements|publisher=www.mypescpe.com|accessdate=24 March 2014}} Individuals must renew their PTIN between October 16 and December 31 of each year. Individuals must file Form 8554, ''Application for Renewal of Enrollment to Practice Before the Internal Revenue Service'', within the applicable renewal period. Renewal periods are based on the last digit of an enrolled agent's [[Social Security number]] (SSN) or [[Tax Identification Number|tax identification number]]: {| class="wikitable sortable" ! style="background:#E0ECF8" align="center" | '''SSN ends in.. ''' ! style="background:#E0ECF8" align="center" | '''Renewal Period''' ! style="background:#E0ECF8" align="center" | '''Effective Date
of Renewal''' ! style="background:#E0ECF8" align="center" | '''CPE Reporting Period ''' |-align="center" | 0, 1, 2, 3 || 11/01/18 – 01/31/19 || 04/01/19 || 01/01/16 – 12/31/18 |-align="center" | 4, 5, 6 || 11/01/16 – 01/31/17 || 04/01/17 || 01/01/14 – 12/31/16 |-align="center" | 7, 8, 9 || 11/01/17 – 01/31/18 || 04/01/18 || 01/01/15 – 12/31/17 |} ===Renewal after initial enrollment cycle=== Individuals admitted to practice at any time during an enrollment cycle, "the three successive enrollment years preceding the effective date of renewal,"TreasuryDepartment Circular No. 230 § 10.6(e)(1)(ii) must complete two hours of continuing professional education for each month of enrollment, including two hours of ethics or professional conduct in each year. If an individual receives initial enrollment between November 1 and April 1 of their applicable renewal period, they will not be required to renew until the expiration of the first full three-year enrollment cycle following their initial enrollment. ===Failure to renew=== An individual who has not filed a timely application for renewal, who has not made a timely response to the notice of noncompliance, or who has not satisfied the requirements of eligibility for renewal, will be placed on a roster of inactive enrolled individuals. During this time, the individual will be ineligible to practice before the Internal Revenue Service and may not state or imply that they are eligible to represent taxpayers, use the term enrolled agent, or use the EA designation. ==Practice before the IRS: Enrolled agents and other practitioners== The right to practice before the Internal Revenue Service is regulated by Federal statute,{{usc|31|330}} and {{usc|5|500}}. and persons authorized to practice are known as "Federally Authorized Tax Practitioners",See also {{usc|26|7525(a)(3)(A)}}, relating to confidentiality of communications. or "FATPs". The FATP status is granted to attorneys, [[Certified Public Accountants|certified public accountants]], and enrolled agents, each having unlimited representation rights before the Internal Revenue Service. These practitioners may represent their clients on any matters including audits, collection actions, payment issues, tax refund matters, and appeals.Internal Revenue Service, "[https://www.irs.gov/Tax-Professionals/Understanding-Tax-Return-Preparer-Credentials Understanding Tax Return Preparer Credentials]" FATP status is also granted with limited representation rights to [[Enrolled actuary|enrolled actuaries]], enrolled retirement plan agents, and [[Registered Tax Return Preparer|registered tax return preparers]]. Enrolled agents, like other FATPs, are subject to a set of procedures and regulations described in Treasury Department Circular No. 230,'' Regulations Governing the Practice of Attorneys, Certified Public Accountants, Enrolled Agents, Enrolled Actuaries, and Appraisers before the Internal Revenue Service''.Codified in regulations at 31 C.F.R. subtitle A, part 10. When practicing before the Internal Revenue Service, enrolled agents may not use the term "certified" in describing their professional designation. An enrolled agent admitted to practice before the Internal Revenue Service may not state or imply that an employer/employee relationship exists between the enrolled agent and the Internal Revenue Service. ==Practice in federal courts== Enrolled agent status does not authorize the enrollee to practice before the [[United States Tax Court]] or in any other court. Practice in U.S. Tax Court is limited to members of the Bar of the Court. The Internal Revenue Code states, "No qualified person shall be denied admission to practice before the Tax Court because of his failure to be a member of any profession or calling."{{usc|26|7452}}. Non-attorneys must pass a Tax Court exam for admission to the Bar of the Court. Attorneys are admitted to the Bar of the Tax Court without having to take the Tax Court examination.See generally Rule 200, Rules of Practice and Procedure, United States Tax Court (eff. July 6, 2012). Practice in other federal courts is generally limited to persons licensed as attorneys.See, e.g., Rule 5, Rules of the Supreme Court of the United States, effective July 1, 2013; Rule 46, Rules and Internal Operating Procedures of the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit (May 2016); Attorney Admissions Requirements, U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Texas (July 2016). ==See also == *[[National Society of Tax Professionals]] (NSTP) *[[American Society of Tax Problem Solvers]] *[[National Association of Enrolled Agents]] (NAEA) *[[National Association of Tax Professionals]] (NATP) *[[National Society of Accountants]] (NSA) *[[Tax advisor]] ==Notes== {{reflist}} {{USGovernment|sourceURL=https://www.irs.gov}} ==References== *U.S. Internal Revenue Service. [https://www.irs.gov/taxpros/agents/article/0,,id=100710,00.html Enrollment overview]. Retrieved January 30, 2006. *National Association of Enrolled Agents [http://www.naea.org NAEA] *[https://www.irs.gov/Tax-Professionals/Understanding-Tax-Return-Preparer-Credentials-and-Qualifications Understanding Tax Return Preparer Credentials] (irs.gov) [[Category:1884 establishments in the United States]] [[Category:Internal Revenue Service]] [[Category:Tax occupations]] [[Category:Business occupations]]

'''Geoffrey Arone''' is an American blockchain investor and advisor.
Arone is currently a partner at Arrington XRP Capital, a hedge fund focused on crypto assets and blockchain tech<ref>{{cite web|title=Michael Arrington Has a New $100 Million Hedge Fund That Will Be Valued in Ripple's XRP|url=http://fortune.com/2017/11/28/arrington-xrp/|accessdate=19 February 2018}}</ref>. He also advises Bloom Protocol<ref>{{cite web|title=Introducing Bloom Advisor: Geoffrey Arone|url=https://blog.hellobloom.io/introducing-advisor-geoffrey-arone-10a4ec41719d|accessdate=19 February 2018}}</ref>, a company reinventing the credit industry with decentralized scoring powered by Ethereum and IPFS. Previously, he was Chief Product Officer at [[Whitepages (company)|Whitepages]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20150211005455/en/Geoffrey-Arone-Joins-Whitepages-Executive-Vice-President|title=Geoffrey Arone Joins Whitepages as Executive Vice President of Products {{!}} Business Wire|website=www.businesswire.com|access-date=2016-09-07}}</ref> Prior to that, he was Chief Scientist of [[Experian]], which acquired SafetyWeb in May 2011.<ref>{{cite web|last=Arrington|first=Michael|title=Experian Acquired Child Safety Startup SafetyWeb|url=https://techcrunch.com/2011/06/06/experian-acquired-child-safety-startup-safetyweb/|work=TechCrunch|publisher=AOL|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref> Arone co-founded SafetyWeb in June 2009 and raised ~ $8 million from [[Battery Ventures]] and [[First Round Capital]].<ref>{{cite web|title=SafetyWeb secures $8M in funding|url=http://www.bizjournals.com/denver/stories/2010/06/14/daily64.html|work=Denver Business Journal|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref> SafetyWeb is a cloud-based personal security company whose products include SafetyWeb Family and myID.
Prior to SafetyWeb, Arone was the CEO and co-founder of DanceJam with [[MC Hammer]] and [[Flock (web browser)|Flock]] co-founder Anthony Young. While running DanceJam, Arone raised two rounds of venture capital and sold the company to Grind Networks in 2009.<ref>{{cite web|last=Arrington|first=Michael|title=DanceJam Finds A Buyer|url=https://techcrunch.com/2009/10/16/dancejam-finds-a-buyer/|work=TechCrunch|publisher=AOL|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref>
In late 2004, Arone co-founded [[Flock (web browser)|Flock]], the first web browser with social network integration, with Bart Decrem and Anthony Young. In all, Flock raised ~ $28 million from [[Bessemer Venture Partners]], Shasta Ventures, and [[Fidelity Ventures]]. Nearly 6 years and 14 million downloads later, Flock was acquired by [[Zynga]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Ha|first=Anthony|title=Zynga Buys Social Browser Flock|url=https://venturebeat.com/2011/01/05/zynga-flock/|work=VentureBeat|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref>
Arone has also held product positions at [[RealNetworks]], Informatica and Oracle. He holds a Sc.B. in Neural Science from [[Brown University]] and his PhD work was also in Neural Science. He earned an MBA from the [[MIT Sloan School of Management]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Geoffrey Arone CrunchBase|url=http://www.crunchbase.com/person/geoffrey-arone|work=CrunchBase.com|publisher=AOL|accessdate=12 April 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist}}

[[Cheah Meng Chi]] （謝夢池）or [[Cheah Choon Seng]] or '''Tjia Tjoen Sen'''（謝春生） or Hsie Yung Kuang （謝榮光）, a Hakka from Meixian, Guangdong, China, was Chinese Vice Consul in Penang from 1895–1903 and from 1906-1907. He was a founding director of the [[Deli Bank]] in Medan, Indonesia.<ref>近代中國駐外領事與海外華人社會領袖角色的遞換－以駐檳榔嶼副領事謝榮光(1895-1907)爲例 (The Modern-China Consulate Abroad and the Transformation of Leadership in Overseas Chinese Community: A Case Study of the Vice Consul in Penang, Hsieh Yung Kuang (1895-1907)) by 張曉威(Siou-Wei Chong)</ref> Born in 1848 in [[Pontianak, Indonesia|Pontianak]], [[Dutch East Indies]]. He was a contractor of provisions and foodstuffs to the Dutch Government for eight years before moving to Kota Raja or Banda Acheh on the east coast of Sumatra where, in addition to those existing contracts he obtained fresh contracts for the construction of railroads and for opium and other revenue farms. He was appointed Lieutenant China, which he held for twenty-one years after which he was made Captain China. The Dutch Government conferred on him the Gold Star for "Trouw en Verdienste" and with a gold medal for outstanding contributions to them. Around 1898 he relinquished management of his business interests there, handing them over to the management of his attorney, Mr. Leong Mok On, and moved to Penang where he lived at No. 8, Leith Street. He was appointed Chinese Vice-Consul to Penang, a position that was taken up by his son-in-law, Mr. [[Leong Fee]], upon his resignation. He had interests in the Tambun mines in Perak and the Bentong mines near Kuala Lumpur. He was a member of the [[Penang Chinese Town Hall]] committee. He married the daughter of the Mayor of Pontianak, Mr. Chong Hi.<ref>Twentieth Century impressions of British Malaya: its history, people, commerce, industries, and resources, by Arnold Wright, Published 1908; p. 770</ref><ref>YAP THIAM HIEN AND ACEH by Daniel S. Lev published by Indonesia 82 (October 2006)</ref><ref>Historical Personalities of Penang By Historical Personalities of Penang Committee, Published by Historical Personalities of Penang Committee, 1986; p. 40</ref> Together with [[Cheong Fatt Tze]] (Tjong Tjen Hsoen), Leong Fee（梁輝, Zhang Yao Xuan（張耀軒, and Foo Choo Choon（胡子春）, he founded the Chung Hua School（中華學校 or 中華學堂, the first modern Chinese school in Malaya teaching in Mandarin.<ref>Re-examination of the “Chinese nationalism” and Categorization of the Chinese in Malaya: The Case of the Chinese in Penang, 1890s-1910s by SHINOZAKI Kaori, Ph.D. student, Graduate School of Arts and Sciences University of Tokyo Email: kaoris@pd.jaring.my presented at The Penang Story – International Conference 2002; 18–21 April 2002, The City Bayview Hotel, Penang, Malaysia organised by The Penang Heritage Trust & STAR Publications</ref> Cheah Choon Seng died on 4 February 1916.<ref>Estate of Cheah Choon Seng, deceased in The Malayan Law Journal By Bashir Ahmad Mallal Published by Malaya Pub. House Ltd, 2007; p. 10</ref>

<!-- Please do not remove or change this AfD message until the discussion has been closed. --> {{Article for deletion/dated|page=Ignasi Puig Claret|timestamp=20181113162410|year=2018|month=November|day=13|substed=yes|help=off}} <!-- Once discussion is closed, please place on talk page: {{Old AfD multi|page=Ignasi Puig Claret|date=13 November 2018|result='''keep'''}} --> <!-- End of AfD message, feel free to edit beyond this point --> '''Ignasi Puig Claret''' ([[Manresa|Manresa, Barcelona]], April 8, 1962) is an advertising entrepreneur, founding partner of SCPF agency (part of the [[WPP plc|WPP]] holding company) and [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] of SCPF America.
== Career == In 1985 he began his professional career in the advertising world at Delvico Bates agency, where he worked until 1987.<ref name=":0">{{cite news|last=|first=|title=In It for the Long Run: Ignasi Puig|url=https://www.advertisingcrossing.com/article/170462/In-It-for-the-Long-Run-Ignasi-Puig/|date=2008-03-10|accessdate=2018-08-30|work=AdvertisingCrossing.com|location=|page=|number=|language=en-us}}</ref> In 1989 he was appointed General Director of the advertising agency Backer Spielvogel Bates ([[Barcelona]] office) until 1992, when Delvico and BSB agencies merged; Puig was named General Manager of the new company.<ref name=":0" />
In January 1996 he created in Barcelona, along with three partners from Delvico Bates, the advertising agency SCPF,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.elpublicista.es/los-mejores-de-2014/scpf-mejor-agencia-publicidad-integrada|title=SCPF, la mejor agencia en publicidad integrada|last=Publicista|first=El|website=www.elpublicista.es|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{cite journal|url=|title=SCPF cumple diez años de talento creativo|last=Kenny|first=Elena|date=17 December 2007|journal=El Nuevo Herald|accessdate=|doi=|pmid=}}</ref> whose name is made up of the initials of its four partners: Toni Segarra, Luis Cuesta, Puig and Felix Fernández de Castro;<ref name=":1" /> Puig becomes Counselor.<ref name=":2">{{cite news|title=Liderazgo sensible: el dilema de manejar el talento en las organizaciones creativas|url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/2103299-liderazgo-sensible-el-dilema-de-manejar-el-talento-en-las-organizaciones-creativas|accessdate=2018-08-30|language=es}}</ref> In 1998 SCPF opened an office in [[Madrid]] and won contests to develop [[IKEA]], [[BMW]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reasonwhy.es/actualidad/anunciantes/bmw-vuelve-confiar-en-scpf-para-su-publicidad-2016-07-01|title=BMW vuelve a confiar en SCPF para su Publicidad {{!}} Reason Why|website=Reason Why|language=es|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref> [[Vodafone]] and [[ING Group|ING]] campaigns, among others.
In the year 2000 WPP buys 30% of the shares of SCPF, and both agencies are part of a [[direct marketing]] company, ''Mr. John Sample'', with Puig Claret as part of the management team.<ref>{{cite news|last=Wert|first=Concha|title=WPP y SCPF crean una agencia de marketing directo|url=https://cincodias.elpais.com/cincodias/2004/01/13/empresas/1074004799_850215.html|date=2004-01-13|accessdate=2018-08-30|work=Cinco Días|language=es}}</ref>
In 2005 WPP completes the acquisition of SCPF;<ref name=":2" /> as a result of the sale, Ignasi Puig starts in [[Miami]] ''SCPF América'',<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2" /><ref>{{cite journal|url=|title=SCPF abre nuevas oficinas en Miami y Lisboa|last=|first=|date=25 July 2005|journal=Anuncios - Semanario de Publicidad y Marketing|number=1113|accessdate=|doi=|pmid=}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|title=SPAIN'S S,C,P,F TO OPEN MIAMI OFFICE|url=http://adage.com/article/hispanic-marketing/spain-s-s-c-p-f-open-miami-office/46353/|accessdate=2018-08-30|language=en}}</ref> with [[Subway (restaurant)|Subway]] and [[HSBC]] among its first clients, and subsequently [[Procter & Gamble]], [[Unilever]], [[Coca-Cola Enterprises|Coca Cola]], [[Banco Santander]], [[Banco Sabadell]], [[Mazda]], [[Johnson & Johnson]], [[Revlon|Revlon,]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Toni Segarra y Luis Cuesta dejan *S,C,P,F… después de fundarla hace 21 años|url=https://dircomfidencial.com/marketing/toni-segarra-y-luis-cuesta-dejan-scpf-despues-de-fundarla-hace-21-anos-20170316-1719/|date=2017-03-16|accessdate=2018-08-30|work=Dircomfidencial|language=es-ES}}</ref><ref name=":1" /> among others. Also [[Non-governmental organization|NGOs]] such as [[Partnership for Drug-Free Kids|Partnership for a Drug Free America]],<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.anuncios.com/campana-creatividad/mas-anuncios/1050926008001/construye-gran-dia.1.html|title=Cómo se construye un gran día - Más Anuncios - Campaña/Creatividad - Anuncios.com|website=www.anuncios.com|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref> [[International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement|Red Cross]] and [[Médecins Sans Frontières|Medicos sin Fronteras]], among others. The company opened offices in [[New York City|New York]], [[Mexico City]], [[Buenos Aires]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.adlatina.com.ar/publicidad/ignasi-puig-%E2%80%9Cno-creemos-que-para-operar-en-un-pa%C3%ADs-haya-que-establecerse-en-ese-pa%C3%ADs%E2%80%9D|title=Adlatina.com - Ignasi Puig: "No creemos que para operar en un país haya que establecerse en ese país"|website=www.adlatina.com.ar|language=es|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref> and [[Bogotá]].
== Awards == With SCPF, Puig Claret won awards at the [[Cannes Film Festival|International Festival of Cannes]]<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2006/06/24/comunicacion/1151167321.html|title=Las agencias españolas consiguen 19 galardones en el Festival de Publicidad de Cannes {{!}} elmundo.es|last=Mundinteractivos|website=www.elmundo.es|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref> and the Festival Iberoamericano de la Comunicacion Publicitaria,<ref>{{cite news|title=La agencia de publicidad *S,C,P,F… premiada en el Festival El Sol - Masters of Design and Innovation|url=https://mastersofdesignandinnovation.com/es/noticias/scpf-gana-el-premio-especial-de-la-prensa-de-el-sol/|accessdate=2018-08-30|work=Masters of Design and Innovation|language=es-ES}}</ref> IAB Awards<ref>{{cite news|title=Los Premios IAB Conecta 2014 reconocieron 9 iniciativas de Coca-Cola México|url=https://www.coca-colamexico.com.mx/sala-de-prensa/Comunicados/los-premios-iab-conecta-2014-reconocieron-9-iniciativas-de-coca-cola-mexico|accessdate=2018-08-30|language=es-MX}}</ref> and Effie Awards.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.adlatina.com.ar/publicidad/scpf%E2%80%A6-gan%C3%B3-la-cuenta-de-replay|title=Adlatina.com - *S,C,P,F… ganó la cuenta de Replay|website=www.adlatina.com.ar|language=es|access-date=2018-09-19}}</ref> In 2009 the agency was recognized with the Coca-Cola Creative Excellence Award in [[Atlanta]].
== References == {{Reflist}} <!--🚫No edites estas líneas-->== Enlaces externos ==
* [http://www.scpf.com/ SCPF - Agencia de publicidad]

Firjan.org.br] | remarks = | formerly = <!--Any former names by which the organization known--> | footnotes = }}
The '''Industry Social Service of the State of Rio de Janeiro''' comprehends SESI's work in [[Rio de Janeiro state]]. The institution focuses in bettering [[workplace|work environment]], [[quality of life]] and [[education]] level of [[Collaboration|collaborators]] from Rio de Janeiro's enterprises. Through programs and mobile units, it carries out actions related to [[health]], education, [[sports]], [[leisure]], [[culture]], [[occupational health]], [[work safety]] and [[environmental protection]]. These activities are aimed at workers and companies, as much as to [[society]] in general. SENAI Rio's history is parallel to the Brazilian industrial development and its designation accompanies Rio de Janeiro's changes, as when it became a capital and was renamed [[Guanabara (state)|Guanabara state]].
== Fields of action == SESI Rio's programs and unities are meant for industry workers, their families and Rio de Janeiro´s population as a whole. In companies, the institution focuses attention on the socially responsible management aiming Brazilian's [[competitive advantage]] and [[sustainable development]]. Besides the quality of life of workers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.abqv.com.br/portal/Content.aspx?id=372|title=ABQV celebra convênio com SESI-RJ|accessdate=1 July 2014|website=Associação Brasileira de Qualidade de Vida}}</ref> In a general way, SESI Rio works in four big fields:<ref name="DR">Rio de Janeiro, Departamento Regional do Estado do. '''SESI Rio de Janeiro''' (1996).</ref>
=== Education === * General Education/Equivalency Diploma (G.E.D.)<ref>{{cite web|url=http://g1.globo.com/rj/regiao-serrana/noticia/2014/06/educacao-para-jovens-e-adultos-em-petropolis-rj-tera-30-novas-vagas.html|title=Educação para jovens e adultos em Petrópolis, RJ, terá 30 novas vagas|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=22 June 2014|website=G1 News Portal}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caxiasdigital.com.br/blog/sesi-oferece-1-170-vagas-gratuitas-em-cursos-para-educacao-basica-de-jovens-e-adultos/|title=SESI oferece 1.170 vagas gratuitas em cursos para educação básica de jovens e adultos|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=24 June 2014|website=Caxias Digital}}</ref> * Preschool * Family promotion (to better the worker's social life and family income through courses) * SESI Rio School
=== Health === * Medical assistance * Occupational health * Odontology<ref>{{cite web|url=http://netdiario.com.br/sesi-oferece-atendimento-medico-e-odontologico/|title=SESI oferece atendimento médico e odontológico|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=18 January 2013|website=NET Diário}}</ref> * Health education
=== Sports/Leisure === * Sporting, artistic and social activities<ref name="DR"/> * Employee participation in championships, as in the case of ''Jogos SESI do Trabalhador'' (Worker's SESI Game),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caxiasdigital.com.br/blog/inscricoes-abertas-para-fase-estadual-dos-jogos-do-sesi-do-trabalhador/|title=Inscrições abertas para fase estadual dos Jogos do SESI do Trabalhador|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=11 October 2013|website=Caxias Digital}}</ref> with contests in regional, state and national stages;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://g1.globo.com/sp/sao-carlos-regiao/noticia/2012/03/65-jogos-sesi-2012-busca-estimular-pratica-esportiva-e-socioeducativa-sao-carlos-sp.html|title=65º Jogos SESI 2012 busca estimular prática esportiva e socioeducativa|accessdate=27 February 2014|website=G1 News Portal}}</ref> * Support of sporting activities in general (as the population's participation in swimming circuit<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globoesporte.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/noticia/2014/06/circuito-rio-sul-sesi-de-natacao-abre-inscricoes-para-segunda-etapa.html|title=Circuito Rio Sul- SESI de Natação abre inscrições para segunda etapa|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=23 June 2014|website=GloboEsporte}}</ref> and athletes' training for the Olympics.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.avozdacidade.com/mobile/noticiasDetalhes.aspx?IDNoticia=13933&IDCategoria=5|title=Nadadores do SESI são pré-convocados para as Olimpíadas de 2016|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=9 April 2012|website=A Voz da Cidade}}</ref>)
=== Culture === * ''SESI Cultural Rio'' program fosters [[creative industry in Brazil]], offering attractions<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caxiasdigital.com.br/blog/sesi-do-rio-promove-quarta-edicao-do-x-tudo-cultural/|title=SESI do Rio promove quarta edição do X-Tudo Cultural|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=8 July 2013|website=Caxias Digital}}</ref> ranging from music shows<ref>{{cite web|url=http://g1.globo.com/rj/sul-do-rio-costa-verde/noticia/2014/06/sandra-de-sa-se-apresenta-em-barra-mansa-no-sul-do-rio-de-janeiro.html|title=Sandra de Sá se apresenta em Barra Mansa, no sul do Rio de Janeiro|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=21 June 2014|website=G1 News Portal}}</ref> to artistic awards.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.otempo.com.br/opini%C3%A3o/j%C3%BAlio-assis/por-favor-sem-flash-1.860899|title=Por favor sem flash|accessdate=1 July 2014|first=Júlio|last=Assis|date=9 June 2014|website=O Tempo}}</ref>
== Programs ==
Due to its social function, SESI Rio focuses on two specific pillars in the state: education and health.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/40288094212F79010121314833326D3B.htm|title=SESI: ultrapassando os muros da indústria|accessdate=21 January 2014|website=Sistema FIRJAN}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/2C908CE9229431C901229F14298918C3.htm|title=Projeto Transformar|accessdate=7 March 2014|website=Sistema FIRJAN}}</ref>
Some of the entity's programs are: * '''[[SESI Mathematics]]''': dedicated for high school students and teachers, this program aims to improve the teaching and learning of mathematics in Brazil in an interactive and playful way;<ref name="bahia">{{cite web|url=http://www.correio24horas.com.br/detalhe/noticia/escolas-baianas-vao-adotar-sesi-matematica/|title=Escolas baianas vão adotar SESI Matemática|accessdate=14 May 2014|date=10 July 2013|website=Correio}}</ref> * '''[[SESI Citizenship]]''': takes education, culture, health, sports, leisure and food education to the residents of Rio de Janeiro's pacified communities;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.folhadirigida.com.br/fd/Satellite/concursos/noticias-Cidadania-2013-2000039669693/SesiCidadania-transforma-vidas-2000040450578-1400002102880|title=SESI Cidadania transforma vidas|accessdate=6 June 2014|website=Folha Dirigida}}</ref> * '''Global Action''': along with [[Rede Globo]], it provides public utility services and actions in specific areas (health, education, leisure and culture) for Rio de Janeiro's inhabitants;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://redeglobo.globo.com/acao-global/noticia/2014/04/no-rio-de-janeiro-acao-global-nacional-aconteceu-no-andarai.html|title=No Rio de Janeiro, Ação Global Nacional aconteceu no Andaraí|accessdate=5 May 2014|date=26 April 2014|website=Rede Globo}}</ref> * '''SESI in Action''': reduced version of "Global Action", is mainly focused on providing services in underserved communities, in partnership with other institutions;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.caxiasdigital.com.br/blog/upp-da-mangueirinha-em-duque-de-caxias-recebe-amanha-o-programa-sesi-em-acao/|title=UPP da Mangueirinha, em Duque de Caxias, recebe amanhã o programa SESI em Ação|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=11 April 2014|website=Caxias Digital}}</ref> * '''MBA in Entrepreneurial Management''': course offered by the [[Federal University of Rio de Janeiro]] for the managers of public schools and of Rio de Janeiro's SESI/SENAI network;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.proppi.uff.br/portalagir/uff-e-firjan-criam-mba-em-gestao-empreendedora|title=UFF e Firjan criam MBA em Gestão Empreendedora|accessdate=1 July 2014|website=Portal Agir, Agência de Inovação}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.gazetadopovo.com.br/educacao/conteudo.phtml?id=1242773|title=Diretores de escolas públicas do Rio e de São Paulo vão cursar MBA|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=10 April 2012|website=Gazeta do Povo}}</ref> * '''Basic education''': includes kindergarten, elementary and middle school with technical course, in addition to professional education; * '''Evaluation in action''': evaluates the student when he or she enters and leaves SESI School, indicating how the student has evolved throughout school life;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/2C908CEC37BB3F3F0137BCF8E30823BE.htm|title=Sistema FIRJAN e Sustentabilidade - Educação (SESI do Rio)|accessdate=1 July 2014|website=Sistema FIRJAN}}</ref> * '''Transform project''': [[partnership]] with Rio de Janeiro´s City Halls to improve the quality of life of its residents through the education of low-income youth and capacitation;<ref>{{cite web|url=http://memoria.ebc.com.br/agenciabrasil/noticia/2002-11-17/firjan-recebe-certificado-da-onu-ao-projeto-transformar|title=Firjan recebe certificado da ONU ao projeto Transformar|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=17 November 2002|website=Agência Brasil / Empresa Brasil de Comunicação-EBC}}</ref> * '''Continuing education''': includes updating classes in [[Portuguese language|Portuguese]] ([[orthography]], reading and [[grammar]]) and in [[mathematics]] ([[number]]s, [[Operation (mathematics)|operations]] and algebra); * '''Brazilian Sign Language''' (''Libras''): transmits the initial knowledge of the language through conversation in basic communication situations; * '''Pre Enem''': studies focused on the [[Exame Nacional do Ensino Médio]],<ref>{{cite web|url=http://odia.ig.com.br/portal/educacao/curso-gratuito-abre-inscri%C3%A7%C3%B5es-para-pr%C3%A9-enem-1.422197|title=Curso gratuito abre inscrições para Pré-Enem|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=21 March 2012|website=O Dia newspaper}}</ref> in order to facilitate the access of low-income students to postsecondary education.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://avozdaserra.com.br/noticias.php?noticia=13488|title=SESI oferece 365 vagas gratuitas em curso preparatório para o Enem|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=2 March 2011|website=A Voz da Serra}}</ref>
== Mobile units ==
The mobile units are trailers and vans with office structure to take up to companies health care for employees. Units can be [[dentistry|dental]], [[occupational health]] and [[x-ray]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.celi.com.br/noticias/leitura/id/840/A_saude_do_colaborador_em_primeiro_lugar|title=A saúde do colaborador em primeiro lugar|accessdate=1 July 2014|date=16 July 2009|website=Construtora Celi}}</ref>
== History ==
Until the early 1940s, Brazil was an agricultural, rural and dependent on imported manufactured goods economy. Gradually the industrial sector was being equipped, but it was still difficult to meet all the needs of the worker. Further during the [[Second World War]]. Then, in 1946 (post-war), the private sector exercised its social function and created SESI.<ref group="note">See [http://www.planalto.gov.br/ccivil_03/decreto-lei/1937-1946/Del9403.htm Decreto-Lei n<sup>o</sup> 9.403, from 25 June 1946], whereby the president of the Brazilian republic ([[Eurico Gaspar Dutra]]) gave "the National Confederation of Industry (CNI) the mission to create, organize and direct the Industry Social Service".</ref> It was industry [[legitimizing]] [[social service]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ebah.com.br/content/ABAAAAoUwAG/servico-social-na-sociedade-capitalista|title=O serviço social na sociedade capitalista|accessdate=30 May 2014|website=Ebah}}</ref> On the same date, its National Department formed the Regional Division of Rio de Janeiro. It was "the beginning of Brazilian industrialization and a new cycle of development that sought to guarantee the country a place in the new international environment."<ref name="DR"/>
=== Industrialization === Between the 50s and the 70s the [[economy]] has changed, with the goal of building an industrialized and competitive society. In 1953, Rio de Janeiro's Regional Division becomes the [[Federal District (Brazil)|Federal District's]] Regional Department, with [[jurisdiction]] on the federal capital. But when the Federal District is transferred to [[Brasília]] and Guanabara State is created, in 1960, it receives the name of Guanabara State's Regional Department. It turns out that, in 1974, then-President [[Ernesto Geisel]] decided to merge the states of Guanabara and Rio de Janeiro (preserving the name of the latter), returning to Rio its ''status'' of the state capital. It is precisely in this time of transition, between 1974 and 1979, that it is created the Regional Department of the State of Rio de Janeiro, current SESI Rio.
=== The so called "lost decade” === During the 80s, dubbed "[[La Década Perdida|the lost decade]]" by economists, SESI Rio "increased in 328% the number of its services in the areas of Food, Entertainment, Health, Education, Service and Community Actions, ie, from 4.2 million to 18 million people."<ref>{{citation|last1=Beloch|first1=I.|last2=Fagundes|first2=L. R.|title=Sistema Firjan: a história dos 170 anos da representação industrial no Rio de Janeiro, 1827-1997|publisher=Memória Brasil Projetos Culturais Ltda.|year=1997}}</ref><ref group="note">From 1980 to 1994.</ref>
=== The 1990s === In the 90s, the policy of expanding through the interior has been strengthened with the installation of units in approximately 10 municipalities.
=== The 2000s === In the 2000s the focus has changed to: * Expertise in Corporate Social Responsibility, with focus on hearing the demands of [[stakeholder (corporate)|stakeholders]] (e.g. [[employees]], [[consumers]], community, government and environment); * Creation of a network of alliances between similar entities; * Increase in the number of Mobile Units; * Appreciation of the sport (as leisure and [[social inclusion]]) through championships; * Creation of [[Distance education|distance learning]] courses for personal qualification.
In recent years, SESI Rio has sought to strengthen its programs for the welfare and quality of life of the citizens of Rio de Janeiro state.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cursogratisonline.com.br/sesi-rj-cursos-e-inscricoes/|title=O SESI do Rio de Janeiro (FIRJAN)|accessdate=1 July 2014|website=Cursos Gratuitos}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.atelrj.org/home/convenios-educacao-1/sesi-rj|title=SESI-RJ|accessdate=1 July 2014|website=Associação dos Técnicos Industriais no Estado do Rio de Janeiro}}</ref>
== Notes == {{reflist|group=note}}
== See also == * [[Education]] * [[Sesinho]]
== References == {{reflist}}
== External links == * [http://guiadoestudante.abril.com.br/profissoes/ciencias-humanas-sociais/servico-social-688043.shtml Student Guide: the social work profession (in Portuguese)] * [http://www.cfess.org.br/#googtrans(pt|en)/ Federal Council of Social Service (CFESS)] * [http://www.firjan.org.br/sesicidadania/ SESI Cidadania (in Portuguese)] * [http://www.firjan.org.br/sesimatematica/ SESI Matemática (in Portuguese)] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20150206065509/http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/2C908CE92593A88101259E111C1C502B.htm FIRJAN System] * [http://redeglobo.globo.com/acao-global/ Global Action – Rede Globo (in Portuguese)] * [http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/2C908CEC2938448E012958C73EBD1925.htm SESI Rio] * [http://www.escolasesi.com.br/ SESI School (in Portuguese)] * [http://www.firjan.org.br/data/pages/2C908CE92593A88101259E112B9C50DA.htm SENAI Rio]
